Sub: 
Anti-hijacking Mock Exercise at  Airports. 
 
In order to  test the efficacy of the contingency plan and to familiarize all 
concerned about the responsibilities of different agencies connected with civil 
aviation operations at the airports it has been decided that mock exercise to test the 
operational   preparedness of all agencies will be conducted at the airport level and 
at the central level as per the following guidelines:- 
 
A. 
Exercise at the Airport Level 
 
i) 
The Anti- Hijacking Exercise (AHE)  shall be conducted once  a year at 
each operational airport in the country wherein all concerned  agencies  at 
the  airport  level   will be  involved  and their  efficacy tested.. 
ii) 
The concerned Chief Airport Security Officer (CASO) in consultation with 
the Airport Director / incharge  Aerodrome   shall be responsible  for   
conducting  the  AHE.  
iii) 
RDCOS   BCAS and  BCAS  HQrs  shall be informed prior to conducting 
AHE.    
iv) 
Report of the AHE shall be sent by CASO through Airport Director/ 
Aerodrome In-charge to RDCOS(CA), Director (Security), AAI and BCAS 
Hqrs within a week positively. 
v) 
The exercise will be stage managed. No aircraft will be used for the 
exercise. A   suitable vehicle will substitute for the hijacked aircraft.  
vi) 
The  Mock  Exercise   will  be  planned  at an  appropriate   time,  
preferably around  flight  times.  Timings  can be  after  the flight  has 
taken off or  before  it has  landed  at the airport. 
vii) 
The Central Committee shall not  be convened. 
viii) 
Operational and administrative tasks shall be clearly mentioned in the 
AHE. 
ix) 
Specific call sign of civil flights shall not be used.  Call sign like XYZ shall 
be used. 
x) 
Unless and until specifically mentioned no RT / WT or any other 
communication of the AHE shall be sent to the respective FIC and Central 
Committee. 
xi) 
Briefing/ debriefing  for the exercise will be done by the CASO/ Airport 
Director concerned. 
xii) 
All administrative arrangements for the AHE  will be made by the 
concerned Airport Director/  Incharge  Aerodrome.

B. 
AHE  at the Central Level 
 
i) 
A full fledged  Exercise may be conducted centrally once  a year. 
ii) 
Exercise plan will be prepared by BCAS and will be circulated to the 
concerned agencies. 
iii) 
Exact date and time of exercise shall  be communicated on need-to-know 
basis. 
iv) 
This will be a full fledged exercise in which all the agencies shall 
participate as per the Contingency Plan. The exercise shall be only to test  
the efficacy of the contingency arrangements  on the  ground and  the   
response of the Central Committee. 
v) 
The mock exercise will be planned at an appropriate time, preferably after 
the flight has taken off or before it has landed at the airport. 
vi) 
All  administrative arrangements for the exercise will be made by the 
concerned Airport Director, AAI in consultation with the RDCOS, BCAS 
concerned. 
vii) 
An aircraft for this exercise will be requisitioned  by BCAS from National 
Carriers/ private airlines. 
viii) 
MCA,  MHA, Cabinet Sectt. , PM Office and Ministry of Defence will be 
kept informed before the AHE by BCAS. 
ix) 
Briefing for this exercise will be done at the BCAS Hqrs. 
x) 
Performance of all agencies during this exercise will be checked. 
xi) 
Central Committee Control Room only shall be activated. 
xii) 
BCAS  will depute umpires for each area. 
xiii) 
Briefing  meeting   will be  convened  at the  earliest  at  BCAS  HQrs.  
comprising  nodal  agencies  eg.  AAI, APSU, NSG , DGCA  etc.  to  
discuss  various  aspects  , short comings  of the AHE.   Minutes will be  
circulated to  MCA and all concerned  for  appropriate  follow up  action.  
xiv) 
De-briefing will be done at the location as well as at the Central 
Committee Control Room. 
 
C.
